page.title: 20St Aidan's School Carlisle
page.content: All the data was collected by 2nd and 3rd Year pupils and History staff of St Aidan's, which is one of four mixed comprehensive schools located in our survey area. The largest, Trinity, has 1700 pupils; Eden is the smallest with 300 and no sixth form. St Aidan's has about 1100 pupils with 100 in the sixth form. The fourth school, Newman, has 650 pupils. Seventy full and part-time teachers work at St Aidan's. Most are graduates and all have pastoral as well as acad- emic duties. The School has financed and developed its own residential cen- tre in Little Langdale, which figures in a comprehensive fieldwork programme The most recent curricular innovation is TVEI, funded by MSC. Falling rolls and a proposed Sixth Form College are St Aidan's main concerns for the immediate future.
